I saw that there was a new feature that had a very useful part glow and didn't see it in game. Then I saw Scott Manley's video and saw the part glow. Any reason why I don't have it?

Edited December 21, 2014 by tygoo7
Hover the mouse over the staging button showing the part you want glowing.
I believe it occurs when you mouse over the staging in VAB/SPH. It will highlight the part associated with that staging control (booster, decoupler, etc)
Your graphics card/processor may also need to have some specific feature for the effect to work, but if it's capable of DirectX 10 or OpenGL 3 (i.e. shader model 4) you should be fine

Then yes, the game is being stupid with your hardware. Post a thread in the support forum with a full DxDiag dump, perhaps there's a fix for it. If not, you can always hope they fix it in the next release See the "bug reporting guidelines" and "self help" threads in that forum first of course.

My 8-year old nVidia 8800GTX is perfectly capable of displaying the new effects. It is a little laggy at times, but not unplayable Meanwhile, certain older integrated chips in laptops and so on may legitimately not have the hardware needed.
